measurements.name: New Patient Volume

evidence.summary: About 450 new patients per month across 3 locations.

measurements.status_reason: No explicit threshold or problem stated for volume.

measurements.name: Average Intake to Scheduled Appointment Time
measurements.source: Average time from initial call to scheduled appointment: 72 hours

evidence.summary: Average time from initial call to scheduled appointment: 72 hours

measurements.status_reason: Exceeds the 48-hour target for routine care.

measurements.name: Worst Case Intake Delay
measurements.source: Worst case delays: up to 2 weeks

evidence.summary: Worst case delays: up to 2 weeks when insurance verification is complex

measurements.status_reason: Significantly exceeds the 48-hour target and average delay.

measurements.name: No-Show Rate (Incomplete Paperwork)
measurements.source: About 30% no-show on first appointment due to incomplete paperwork.

evidence.summary: Patients don't return intake forms - about 30% no-show on first appointment due to incomplete paperwork.

measurements.status_reason: Significantly exceeds typical healthy error rates (target <5%).

measurements.name: Insurance Verification Time per Patient
measurements.source: Insurance verification takes 45 minutes per patient on average

evidence.summary: Insurance verification takes 45 minutes per patient on average, tying up staff.

measurements.status_reason: No explicit threshold provided, but noted as tying up staff.

measurements.name: Data Entry Error Rate (Allergies & Medications)
measurements.source: About 15% error rate on allergies and medications

evidence.summary: Data entry errors when transcribing from paper to EHR - about 15% error rate on allergies and medications.

measurements.status_reason: Significantly exceeds typical healthy error rates (target <5%).

measurements.name: SLA Failure Rate (Intake within 48 hours)
measurements.source: About 30% of new patients fail to complete intake within the 48-hour SLA.

evidence.summary: About 30% of new patients fail to complete intake within the 48-hour SLA.

measurements.status_reason: Significantly exceeds typical healthy error rates (target <5%).

measurements.name: Manual Effort (Data Entry & Verification) per Patient
measurements.source: Staff spends 2 hours per patient on manual data entry and verification.

evidence.summary: Staff spends 2 hours per patient on manual data entry and verification.

measurements.name: Number of Systems Used in Intake

evidence.summary: Systems listed: Phone system (RingCentral), Email (Outlook), Fax machine, EHR system (Athenahealth), Insurance verification (manual phone calls), Google Calendar, Excel spreadsheet

measurements.status_reason: Significantly exceeds typical healthy system count for a single process.

bleed_assumptions.label: No-Show Rate due to Incomplete Paperwork
bleed_assumptions.source: about 30% no-show on first appointment due to incomplete paperwork

bleed_assumptions.label: Cost per No-Show (Lost Revenue)
bleed_assumptions.source: Each no-show costs approximately $200 in lost revenue.
